intro: Mitrephora sorsogonensis, commonly known as the Sorsogon Strait hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Anacardiaceae family, which includes cashew and poison ivy. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within its native range. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
